data.title: Facebook Might Ban Political Ads Ahead of Election
data.text: Facebook Inc. is considering imposing a ban on political ads on its social network in the days leading up to the U.S. election in November, according to people familiar with the company’s thinking. Kurt Wagner broke the story and reports on "What'd You Miss?"

data.title: Facebook considers to pause political ads during the election
data.text: CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports that Facebook is considering to pause political ads during the election to help level the plain field, first reported by Bloomberg and the New York Times.

data.title: Facebook Reportedly Considers Political Ad Ban For 2020 Election
data.text: Advertisements spreading election-related misinformation were a major issue in 2016.

data.title: Facebook weighs banning political ads before the 2020 election
data.text:
As hundreds of advertisers boycott the the social media monolith over its divisive content, a political blackout may be coming in the lead-up to the 2020 presidential election.
 Political ads on Facebook have long proven a lightning rod for controversy.

data.title: Facebook considers banning political ads in days before US election
data.text: Facebook is considering banning political advertising on its platform in the days leading up to the US presidential election in November, a person familiar with the discussions told CNN. The potential ban has been under consideration since last fall, the person said.

data.title: NAACP president says he wants ‘outcomes, not words’ from Facebook
data.text: The president and CEO of the NAACP is ready for a long-haul battle with Facebook. In an interview with The Post, Derrick Johnson said he and other civil rights organizers will keep up the heat on the social network until it makes concrete changes to help curb misinformation and hate speech on its platform.

data.title: Facebook Said to Consider Banning Political Ads
data.text: The social network has been under intense pressure for allowing misinformation and hate speech to spread on its site.

data.title: Facebook reportedly considers political ad ban ahead of US election
data.text: The social network has faced criticism over it political ad policies.

data.title: Recent Boycotts Could Make Facebook Stock a Good Opportunity
data.text:
The pressured ad market and boycott against its platforms are two negative catalysts for FB stock, which is otherwise attractive.
The post Recent Boycotts Could Make Facebook Stock a Good Opportunity appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Chamath Palihapitiya: Here's why you go short big tech stocks Facebook and Alphabet right now
data.text: Chamath Palihapitiya, founder and CEO of investment firm Social Capital, built a bear case on Facebook and Google parent Alphabet in a series tweets Friday.

data.title: 3 Places Advertisers Are Still Increasing Spend Despite COVID-19
data.text: These three channels are expected to keep growing in the second half of the year.

data.title: Facebook bug causing Spotify, Tinder and Pinterest apps to crash
data.text: The iPhone apps for Spotify, Tinder and Pinterest are crashing for users around the world, apparently due to a Facebook bug.

data.title: Albion's Ware: Maintain a "sizable allocation" in tech for both the near and long term
data.text: Jason Ware, partner and chief investment officer at Albion Financial Group, talks the strength of the tech sector amid a string of Nasdaq record highs.

data.title: How Would Big Tech Firms Deal With H.K. Security Law?
data.text: Christopher Martin, head of region for Asia and the U.S. at Access Partnership, a technology policy consulting firm, discusses how the new security law China imposed on Hong Kong affects technology giants.
